job.title: Software Engineer
job.description: Position: Software Engineer IVLocation: Raleigh, North CarolinaDuration: Full-time, PermanentStart: ASAPPay: COMPETITIVEThis position performs complex research, design, and software development assignments within a software functional area or product line, and provides direct input to project plans, schedules, and methodology in the development of cross-functional software products. This position performs software design â typically across multiple systems; mentors more-junior members of the team; and talks to users/customers and translates their requests into solutions. MUST HAVE QUALIFICATIONS:â¢ 5+ years of Software Engineering experienceâ¢ BS Engineering/Computer Science or equivalent experience required MUST HAVE TECHNICAL SKILLS:â¢ Advanced knowledge of software development methodologies (e.g., Agile, Waterfall).â¢ Strong proficiency with data manipulation language including optimization techniques.â¢ Strong understanding of normalized/dimensional data modeling principles.â¢ Strong knowledge of multiple data storage subsystems.â¢ Expertise (emphasis in bold) in development languages including but not limited to: C#, Java/J2EE, JavaScript, JSP, C/C++, HTML, XML, SQL, Windows, UNIX, and .Net.â¢ Strong research skills.â¢ Strong knowledge in industry best practices in development.â¢ Knowledge in using and developing applicable tool sets.â¢ Ability to interface competently with other technical personnel or team members to finalize requirements.â¢ Ability to work well with internal and external technology resources.â¢ Knowledge of test-driven development.â¢ Ability to write and review portions of detailed specifications for the development of complex system components.â¢ Ability to complete complex bug fixes.â¢ Good oral and written communications skills.MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:â¢ Interface with other technical personnel or team members to finalize requirements.â¢ Write and review portions of detailed specifications for the development of complex system components.â¢ Complete complex bug fixes.â¢ Work closely with other development team members to understand complex product requirements and translate them into software designs.â¢ Successfully implement development processes, coding best practices, and code reviews.â¢ Operate in various development environments (Agile, Waterfall, etc.) while collaborating with key stakeholders.â¢ Resolve complex technical issues as necessary.â¢ Train entry-level software engineers as directed by department management, ensuring they are knowledgeable in critical aspects of their roles.â¢ Keep abreast of new technology developments.â¢ Design and work with complex data models.â¢ Mentor less-senior software developers on development methodologies and optimization techniques.â¢ All other duties as assigned
